intro: Tibouchina longifolia var. hispida, commonly known as the roughleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, velvety leaves that are covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. The plant produces clusters of showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. This ornamental plant is often used in gardens for its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various growing conditions.
